claim_summary: Complaints department confirms suicide was logged 11 days late (17 Apr vs attempt on 6 Apr), directs to SAR for records, and treats July as live reference after confusion — reinforcing 'holiday alibi' narrative and safeguarding failure.
key_points: Directed to SAR for access amid safeguarding concerns.
States July (472401246) is the 'live' reference; November (47240214305) remains separate.
Acknowledges meeting planned with Veritas and police supervisors; victim requests new investigator and supervisory review.

contradictions.title: Suicide attempt 06-04-2025 logged on 17-04-2025
contradictions.claim: Confirms safeguarding-critical event was not recorded for 11 days while OIC/supervisors on leave.

contradictions.title: Live case status toggled between July and November
contradictions.claim: Handler confirms July is live after prior messaging said November; indicates timeline manipulation risk.

contradictions.title: Directed to SAR for access during live safeguarding issues
contradictions.claim: Complaints handler points to SAR route instead of providing safeguarding-relevant updates.

contradictions.title: Repeated reliance on 'on holiday' to explain safeguarding gaps
contradictions.claim: Complaints call leans on leave status to justify delays.

timeline_hooks.note: Complaints call with discussion of delayed suicide logging and crime reference status.
